intro: Erithalis timon, commonly known as the golden sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. Its root system is deep and robust, allowing it to access moisture from underground water sources. Erithalis timon plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
